author: Special Correspondent
text:
Collector M. Karunakaran inspecting the site at Narasinganallur finalised for construction of houses for transgenders.— Photo: A. Shaikmohideen

The dream of having a permanent concrete shelter has become a reality for 29 transgenders when Collector M. Karunakaran formally inaugurated the construction of houses for them at Narasinganallur near here on Tuesday.

Accompanied by public representatives, Dr. Karunakaran participated in the ‘bhoomi puja’ for constructing 29 independent houses for the transgenders near Narasinganallur before participating in the gram sabha meeting.

The Collector said more than 12,000 green houses had been constructed in the district over the past five years and 5,000 houses were being built in the villages around Kudankulam Nuclear Power Project under the ‘KKNPP Neighbourhood Development Programme’ in the first phase. In the second phase, another 5,000 houses would be built, all worth about Rs. 300 crore.

“Under this scheme, Rs. 87 lakh has been sanctioned for constructing 29 houses for transgenders at Narasinganallur. Each house, costing about Rs. 3 lakh, will have a plinth area of 300 square feet,” Dr. Karunakaran said.

Assistant Collector (Training) K.P. Karthikeyan, MPs S. Muthukaruppan, K.R.P. Prabhakaran and Vijila Sathyananth, MLA Nainar Nagenthran and senior government officials participated.
title: 29 transgenders to get independent houses
